Generation I.Red: Rarely seen in the wild. Huge and vicious, it is capable of destroying entire cities in a rage.
Generation I.Green: (This entry was originally untranslated in English until it was reused in Pokémon FireRed .)
Generation I.Blue: Rarely seen in the wild. Huge and vicious, it is capable of destroying entire cities in a rage.
Generation I.Yellow: Brutally vicious and enormously destructive. Known for totally destroying cities in ancient times.
Generation I.Stadium: Extremely vicious and horribly brutal. Has enough destructive power to totally annihilate even a major city.

Generation II.Gold: They say that during past wars, Gyarados would appear and leave blazing ruins in its wake.
Generation II.Silver: Once it appears, it goes on a rampage. It remains enraged until it demolishes everything around it.
Generation II.Crystal: It appears whenever there is world conflict, burning down any place it travels through.
Generation II.Stadium 2: They say that during past wars, Gyarados would appear and leave blazing ruins in its wake. (Pokémon Red, Silver, or Crystal inserted) Once it appears, it goes on a rampage. It remains enraged until it demolishes everything around it. (Pokémon Blue, Gold, or Yellow inserted)

Generation III.Ruby: When Magikarp evolves into Gyarados , its brain cells undergo a structural transformation. It is said that this transformation is to blame for this Pok é mon 's wildly violent nature.
Generation III.Sapphire: Once Gyarados goes on a rampage, its ferociously violent blood doesn't calm until it has burned everything down. There are records of this Pok é mon 's rampages lasting a whole month.
Generation III.Emerald: It is an extremely vicious and violent Pok é mon . When humans begin to fight, it will appear and burn everything to the ground with intensely hot flames.
Generation III.FireRed: It has an extremely aggressive nature. The Hyper Beam it shoots from its mouth totally incinerates all targets.
Generation III.LeafGreen: Rarely seen in the wild. Huge and vicious, it is capable of destroying entire cities in a rage.

Generation IV.Diamond: Once it appears, its rage never settles until it has razed the fields and mountains around it.
Generation IV.Pearl: In ancient literature, there is a record of a Gyarados that razed a village when violence flared.
Generation IV.Platinum: Once it begins to rampage, a Gyarados will burn everything down, even in a harsh storm.
Generation IV.HeartGold: They say that during past strife, Gyarados would appear and leave blazing ruins in its wake.
Generation IV.SoulSilver: Once it appears, it goes on a rampage. It remains enraged until it demolishes everything around it.

Generation V.Black: Once it begins to rampage, a Gyarados will burn everything down, even in a harsh storm.
Generation V.White: Once it begins to rampage, a Gyarados will burn everything down, even in a harsh storm.
Generation V.Black 2: Once it begins to rampage, a Gyarados will burn everything down, even in a harsh storm.
Generation V.White 2: Once it begins to rampage, a Gyarados will burn everything down, even in a harsh storm.

Generation VI.X: In ancient literature, there is a record of a Gyarados that razed a village when violence flared.
Generation VI.Y: Rarely seen in the wild. Huge and vicious, it is capable of destroying entire cities in a rage.
Generation VI.Omega Ruby: When Magikarp evolves into Gyarados, its brain cells undergo a structural transformation. It is said that this transformation is to blame for this Pokémon's wildly violent nature.
Generation VI.Alpha Sapphire: Once Gyarados goes on a rampage, its ferociously violent blood doesn't calm until it has burned everything down. There are records of this Pokémon's rampages lasting a whole month.

Generation VII.Sun: Mega Evolution also affects its brain, leaving no other function except its destructive instinct to burn everything to cinders.
Generation VII.Moon: It jets water from the orifices on its sides, streaking above the water surface at supersonic speed.
Generation VII.Ultra Sun: Mega Evolution places a burden on its body. The stress causes it to become all the more ferocious.
Generation VII.Ultra Moon: It zooms out of the water at Mach speeds. Even large ships caught in its path are split cleanly in two!
Generation VII.Let's Go Pikachu: Although it obeys its instinctive drive to destroy everything within its reach, it will respond to orders from a Trainer it truly trusts.
Generation VII.Let's Go Eevee: Although it obeys its instinctive drive to destroy everything within its reach, it will respond to orders from a Trainer it truly trusts.

Generation VIII.Sword: It has an extremely aggressive nature. The Hyper Beam it shoots from its mouth totally incinerates all targets.
Generation VIII.Shield: Once it begins to rampage, a Gyarados will burn everything down, even in a harsh storm.
Generation VIII.Brilliant Diamond: Once Gyarados appears, its rage never settles until the Pokémon has razed the fields and mountains around it.
Generation VIII.Shining Pearl: In ancient literature, there is a record of a Gyarados that razed a village when violence flared.
Generation VIII.Legends: Arceus: I suspect this Pokémon to be the true identity of a dragon written of in ancient texts, which claimed that it razed an entire village with white-hot beams from its maw.

Generation IX.Scarlet: Once it appears, it goes on a rampage. It remains enraged until it demolishes everything around it.
Generation IX.Violet: It appears whenever there is world conflict, burning down any place it travels through.
